name: salesforce-org-quick-pick
description: Quickly switch between Salesforce orgs from the status bar without breaking your flow.
author: trevSmart

salesforceOrgQuickPick.orgFilters.description: Array of glob patterns to filter which Salesforce org aliases to show. If empty, all orgs are shown. Examples: 'DEV*', 'PROD', '*TEST*'

enumDescriptions: Only show orgs that match the filter patterns
Show all orgs except those that match the filter patterns
salesforceOrgQuickPick.filterMode.description: Whether to include or exclude orgs matching the filter patterns

salesforceOrgQuickPick.browser.description: Browser to use when opening Salesforce orgs

salesforceOrgQuickPick.showTooltip.description: Show interactive tooltip with clickable org aliases on status bar hover

salesforceOrgQuickPick.aliasLabels.description: Map of org aliases to short labels for status bar elements. If not specified, the full alias will be used. Example: {"my-very-long-alias-name": "DEV"}

salesforceOrgQuickPick.hideMainLabelWhen.description: Hide the main status bar picker label when a dedicated quick access item exists for the current org, showing only the icon

salesforceOrgQuickPick.showOpenOrgButton.description: Show the open org button in the status bar to navigate to the default org in the browser

enumDescriptions: Highlight only when using dedicated buttons
salesforceOrgQuickPick.highlightCurrentT.description: When to highlight the current target org in the status bar

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
scripts.package: mkdir -p dist && npx vsce package --out dist
scripts.install-extension: npm run compile && npm run clean && npm run package && cursor --install-extension dist/salesforce-org-quick-pick-*.vsix --force
